text: Hugh Hesketh Hughes (October 1902 - 23 May 1940) was a Welsh champion polo player who trained in Argentina. ==Biography== He was born in October 1902 in Flintshire, Wales. He participated in the 1936 International Polo Cup. He was a second lieutenant in the Welsh Guards during World War II and was killed on 23 May 1940 in France. He is buried in the St. Martin-Boulogne Communal Cemetery. == References == Category:1902 births Category:1940 deaths Category:Welsh polo players Category:International Polo Cup Category:People from Flintshire
